metric: 1.1 Program Executability: The system can start normally and enter the main menu interface.
description: 1. **Act:** Execute the program startup command in the shell (e.g., python src/main_console.py).\n2. **Assert:** Observe whether the program starts successfully and displays a clear main menu with function options.
expected_output: 2 points: The program starts successfully and displays a main menu with function options. 1 point: The program starts but the menu options are unclear or garbled. 0 points: The program fails to start or crashes immediately after starting.

metric: 2.1.1.1 Member Information Entry: Date Format Validation - Birth/Death dates must conform to the YYYYMMDD format.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Prepare member information where the birth date or death date is in an invalid format (e.g., '1990-01-01' or '900101').\n2. **Act:** Select the add new member function and attempt to submit the prepared information.\n3. **Assert:** Observe whether the system prompts a date format error (e.g., "Date format should be YYYYMMDD") and prevents submission.
expected_output: 2 points: Correctly identifies and rejects all date inputs not in YYYYMMDD format. 1 point: Some invalid dates are accepted or the prompt is unclear. 0 points: The system does not validate date formats.

metric: 2.1.1.2 Member Information Entry: Value Range Validation - Height is limited to between 50-300cm.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Prepare member information with an invalid height value (e.g., 40 or 350).\n2. **Act:** Select the add new member function and attempt to submit the prepared information.\n3. **Assert:** Observe whether the system prompts a height range error (e.g., "Height range should be between 50-300cm") and prevents submission.
expected_output: 2 points: Correctly intercepts all height inputs outside the 50-300cm range. 1 point: Some invalid height values are accepted or the prompt is unclear. 0 points: The system does not validate the height range.

metric: 2.1.1.3 Member Information Entry: Education Enumeration Validation - Must match predefined education values.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Prepare member information with an invalid education value (e.g., 'Postdoctorate').\n2. **Act:** Select the add new member function and attempt to submit the prepared information.\n3. **Assert:** Observe whether the system prompts an education value error (e.g., "Education must be one of Elementary School/Junior High/High School/Bachelor/Master/PhD") and prevents submission.
expected_output: 2 points: Correctly validates all education inputs, accepting only predefined enumeration values. 1 point: Some invalid education values are accepted or the prompt is unclear. 0 points: The system does not validate education.

metric: 2.1.1.4 Member Information Entry: Relationship Logic Validation - Specified relatives must exist in the system.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Prepare member information specifying a relative name that does not exist in the system.\n2. **Act:** Select the add new member function and attempt to submit the prepared information.\n3. **Assert:** Observe whether the system prompts that the specified relative does not exist (e.g., "The specified relative XXX does not exist in the system") and prevents submission.
expected_output: 2 points: Correctly validates if the specified relative exists in the system, prompts if not found. 1 point: Validation logic is incomplete or the prompt is unclear. 0 points: The system does not validate the existence of the relative.

metric: 2.1.2.1 Member Information Storage: CSV File Creation and Data Writing.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Ensure the data.csv file does not exist in the project directory.\n2. **Act:** Run the program for the first time and enter member information.\n3. **Assert:** Check whether the data.csv file is created in the project directory and contains the newly entered member information.
expected_output: 2 points: Successfully creates data.csv and writes data correctly. 1 point: There are warning messages during creation or writing. 0 points: File not created, content incorrect, or program crashes.

metric: 2.1.2.2 Member Information Storage: Incremental Storage Mode - Append New Member Information.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Ensure there is a data.csv file with at least one member in the project directory.\n2. **Act:** Enter a new member again.\n3. **Assert:** Check whether the data.csv file appends the new member information while retaining the original data.
expected_output: 2 points: Correctly writes new data in append mode without overwriting existing data. 1 point: There are warning messages or efficiency issues when writing new data. 0 points: New data overwrites old data or writing fails.

metric: 2.2.1.1 Tree Structure Construction: Member Class Definition and Root Node Setting.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Input at least one member.\n2. **Act:** Check the generated family tree structure.\n3. **Assert:** Confirm that the Member object includes idx, kids, spouse attributes and the first member is set as the root node (relationship type is -1).
expected_output: 2 points: Member class is defined correctly, root node is set correctly. 1 point: Some properties or logic are incomplete. 0 points: Member class definition is incorrect or root node setting fails.

metric: 2.2.1.2 Tree Structure Construction: Bidirectional Spouse Relationship and Shared Children.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Input a pair of spouses and their children.\n2. **Act:** Check the generated family tree structure.\n3. **Assert:** Confirm that the spouse attributes of both parties correctly point to each other and their kids lists are consistent and include the children.
expected_output: 2 points: Spouse relationships are correctly established bidirectionally, children are shared by both. 1 point: Relationship establishment is incorrect but some functions are usable. 0 points: Spouse relationship or shared children logic is completely wrong.

metric: 2.2.1.3 Tree Structure Construction: Parent-Child Relationship Establishment and Index Lookup.
description: 1. **Arrange:** Input a parent-child relationship.\n2. **Act:** Check the generated family tree structure and try to find a member by name.\n3. **Assert:** Confirm that the parent's kids list includes the index of the child, and the system can find the member's position in the family list by name.
expected_output: 2 points: Parent-child relationships can be correctly established and index lookup is accurate. 1 point: There are minor issues in relationships or lookup logic. 0 points: Parent-child relationship establishment or index lookup fails.

metric: 2.2.2.1a Relationship Query: Parent Query Algorithm and Generation Control - Query First Generation Parents
description: 1. **Arrange:** Build a family structure with at least a parent-child relationship.\n2. **Act:** Select the relationship query function, then select "Parent Query" and specify the target member and generation as 1.\n3. **Assert:** Check whether the returned result correctly includes the parent information of the target member.
expected_output: 2 points: Can correctly query parent members of the specified generation. 1 point: Query result is incorrect or generation control is inaccurate. 0 points: Parent query function is completely non-functional.
